column4: Anyone here very familiar with the 3D settings in ubuntu 12.04 paired with nvidia 7 series cards? I have a question that no one has been able to figure out :)
what's the question ?
any thoughts?
in a terminal , glxinfo | grep 3D
- if this helps, when I click on one of the binds in the Keyboard Shortcut list, it says 'New accelerator...' can't read the rest.
have you installed the restricted driver in jockey (alt+f2) for your nvidia graphics card?
- Not sure how do I check?
pastebin the output from this command , glxinfo | grep OpenGL
did you see my post about OpenGL ?
yea so i have pastebinit installed, its not pasting though, maybe I'm doing it wrong
...stuff to do for 20 mins or so , errands
just copy and paste the text from that command to here, http://pastebin.com/
yes
glxinfo | grep OpenGL
you have the up to date/latest nvidia driver installed
as far as I know
- so you want me to change to the restricted one? Is that what u mean?
no ,that's the correct driver..there's nothing else i can recommend
- ok thanks anyway :) we tried hehe
well when I look at the Additional Drivers list, none of them are activated.
a newer version recently installed thru the repos if you udated and upgraded in the last 2 weeks
gotcha thanks :)
did you create a nvidia-xconfig file ?
I did a while ago yes
